subject: Programming
title: The Psychology of Estimation
description: A quick, practical guide to The Psychology of Estimation.

hook.text: How long will this feature take? Two days. It took two weeks. Every developer has lived this story.

buildup.text: The planning fallacy makes humans consistently underestimate time, cost, and complexity of tasks.

discovery.text: We estimate based on best-case scenarios and forget about meetings, bugs, reviews, and sick days.

twist.text: Adding buffer doesn't fix it. Parkinson's Law says work expands to fill the time available.

climax.text: The best estimates come from breaking work into tiny pieces and using past data, not gut feeling.

punchline.text: Estimate in hours, not days. Reality hides in the details.
